0: `superuser do`. Its a program that allows users to exec \n\tcmds with the privileges of another user, most commonly the root user.
1: What can a user who is granted sudo access generally perform that would be restricted on other user accounts?
Installing software and modifying system configurations
2: What is the root user also known as?
superuser--root user is a special user account that has complete control over the system. Root user has the ability to read, write, and exec any file or cmds on the system.
